td.content: s:pt presents with critical shortness of breath, critical cough and Respiratory for 2 weeks. he has a history of Asthma for past 4 years. patient is a m aged 46 ys. occasional EtOH he does not smoke o:Height 73 in, Weight 201 lbs, Temperature 97.8 F, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 14, Arterial Blood Gas 7.4,PaCO2=44 mmHg,PaO2=60 mmHg, Chest X-Ray shows hyperinflated lung, SaO2 89% RA; 93% on 4L NC, Alert, Mod distress in pt ""tripod-ding"" for breath, PCO2 elevated on ABG, PEF: 25% expected, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Asthma p:administered methylprednisolone - 60 mg Intravenous, performed Arterial Blood Gas, Chest X-Ray, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

td.content: s:46 year old white m personal trainer presents with Heart. he is having symptoms 4-6 x day, in spite of treatment. o:Height 74 in, Weight 209 lbs, Temperature 98.2 F, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 16, Transthoracic echocardiography shows Ventricular Septal Rupture a:Myocardial Infarction p:administered nitroglycerin - 2.5 mg 2 x day, performed Transthoracic echocardiography, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

s:patient says he is having symptoms of Liver 14-16 x day, in spite of treatment. he is a white m aged 46 yrs. Alcohol 1-4 beers/month he does not smoke o:Height 74 in, Weight 208 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 16, US Liver shows evidence of ascites, hepatic nodularity, increased hepatic echogenicity a:Cirrhosis p:administered Prednisone - 60 mg /day x 1 week, then 50 mg/day, performed US Liver, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

td.content: s:pt presents with Liver for about 3 weeks. pt is a male aged 47 years. o:Height 74 in, Weight 209 lbs, Temperature 98.2 F, Pulse 80, SystolicBP 115, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 17 a:Cirrhosis p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to internal medicine.

s:a 47 yo m personal trainer presents with Liver for 2 days. he has a history of Cirrhosis for past 1 year. Alcohol 1-4 beers/month Patient does not smoke o:Height 73 in, Weight 202 lbs, Temperature 97.9 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 65, Respiration 15 a:Cirrhosis p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed Azathioprine - 3 mg/kg daily, and ordered transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunts - liver.

td.content: s:patient presents with Heart x 7 weeks. patient is a white M aged 47 yrs. o:Height 74 in, Weight 208 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 16, Transthoracic echocardiography shows Ventricular Septal Rupture a:Myocardial Infarction p:administered nitroglycerin - 2.5 mg 2 x day, performed Transthoracic echocardiography, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

s:patient presents with 14 months history of severe chest tightness. patient is a white M personal trainer aged 47 Ys. o:Height 73 in, Weight 201 lbs, Temperature 97.8 F, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 65, Respiration 14, FEV1 FEV1=70 %, FEV1/VFC FEV1/VFC=80 %, PEF PEF=36 %, Pulse Oximetry O2Sat=83 %(at-room-air), O2 Sat: 90%, HEENT: WNL, Skin: mild perioral cyanosis, Pulm: mod bil wheezing with rales on LLL, wheeze-BIL, Mild distress in ""must sit up to breathe"", A&O x 3, Ext. No clubbing, cyanosis, edema, rales-LR, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest: RRR, audible wheezes w/o stethoscope a:Asthma p:administered Prednisone - 20 mg orally, performed FEV1, FEV1/VFC, PEF, Pulse Oximetry, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
